column2: The British Federation

By granting all our white colonies the same rights and privileges as those enjoyed by British citizens and expanding direct political representation to these realms we could build the foundation of a long-lasting, intercontinental British superpower.
The British Commonwealth
By granting all our colonial subjects the same rights and privileges enjoyed by British nationals we would create a working intercontinental democracy.
The British Commonwealth of Nations
Creating this organisation would let us keep certain ties with our former colonies and make it easier for us to influence them.
Join the United Nations
Joining the United Nations would both increase our international prestige and diplomatic abilities, although we will also be subject to more intense scrutiny from the international community.
Found the United Nations

If everything goes to plan, the United Nations will be the first organisation to bind the nations of the world so tightly together and to standardise human rights across borders. Being its architect would mean holding the moral high ground for years to come but it would also mean being restrained by its idealism.
